meanings.definition: To rush out or away from a place.
meanings.sent1: The scared cat outrushed from the noisy room.
meanings.sent2: The children outrushed from the school when the bell rang.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outrushed from the tree when it saw a big dog approaching.
meanings.sent4: The water outrushed from the broken pipe, flooding the basement.
meanings.sent5: The runner outrushed from the starting line, eager to begin the race.

meanings.sent1: She outrushed from the building before the fire alarm went off.
meanings.sent2: The birds outrushed from their nests at the first sign of danger.
meanings.sent3: The students outrushed from the classroom as soon as the final bell rang.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood outrushed from her mind as she grew older.
meanings.sent5: The emotions outrushed from him as he watched the touching movie.
